Class Mock<A,B>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Mock<A,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the type of the input argument
    B - the type of the returned result
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Mockable<A,B>

    public class Mock<A,B>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Mockable<A,B>

    This class is used for mocking the effective objects and provides the necessary operations that correspond to the Mockable interface (execute without and with parameters).

    Author:
    Theodor Stoican

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mock()
      A constructor that initializes every field inside the class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void andBeDoneWithIt()
      A method that sets the watcher on off state, meaning that Mockito will not listen to any further behavioral settings.
      Unit execute()
      The execute method without parameters that overrides the one provided inside the interface.
      B execute(A arg)
      The overridden execute method with parameters.
      Mock<A,B> thenReturn(B arg)
      A method that supplies the previously created mock with elements to return
      Mock<A,B> thenThrow(java.lang.RuntimeException e)
      A method that deals with the setting of the throwing behaviour.

        java.lang.RuntimeException

          throws java.lang.RuntimeException

        The overridden execute method with parameters.

      • thenReturn

        public Mock<A,B> thenReturn(B arg)

        A method that supplies the previously created mock with elements to return

        Parameters:
        arg -
        Returns:
        Mock the same mock of this type, in order to fix further behaviour

      • thenThrow

        public Mock<A,B> thenThrow(java.lang.RuntimeException e)

        A method that deals with the setting of the throwing behaviour. When executing, it will throw the respective exception

        Parameters:
        e - an exception which inherits RuntimeException
        Returns:
        Mock the same mock object, in order to be further used

      • andBeDoneWithIt

        public void andBeDoneWithIt()

        A method that sets the watcher on off state, meaning that Mockito will not listen to any further behavioral settings. The execution may begin afterwards.
